message: I'm a foreigner who will be visiting SF.  What's the best way to get connected to the Internet when I'm on the road?
There are quite a few cafes that offer free wireless internet (assuming you buy coffee from them or something).  Check Yelp for more info, depending on where in the city you'll be.
the best way is to get a sim card

Depends on the time you will be spending. But if you are not into overpaying for cellphone roaming charges, you should get an MiFi or similar and use Google Voice, Twilio or Skype for calls. About WiFi spots in the city, well you can go to almost any Starbucks and get free albeit slow Internet, but believe me, hanging in SBs all day gets old pretty fast.

As someone who tried to live without a smart phone in the city for a month - I can say that it's totally possible to pull it off. If you have a wifi portable device (in my case, an iPod Touch) it's a great way to find free WiFi. Walk around a block in any direction around SF, you'll find a couple dozen hotspots. Quick enough for checking email and that sort of thing. Obviously, cafes are your best bet and some cafes dont have plugs on purpose so as to deter long term users or just that it's a super popular cafe.
